        <div class="sm-12 lg-8">
            <div class="message-text A-TYP16R-RW-ALL"><p>HSBC will never ask customers to contact third-party insurance companies via SMS links or phone numbers.             <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_main_richtext_1" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p>To apply for our VHIS Flexi Plan, you'll need to meet these requirements:</p>
<div class="commonMark-list">
<ul role="list">
<li>the policyholder is aged<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-lastbirthdaydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">8</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 8</span></a></sup> between 18 and 80 years</li>
<li>the insured person is aged<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-lastbirthdaydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">8</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 8</span></a></sup> between 15 days and 80 years</li>
</ul>
</div>
<p></p>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Applying online? Here's what you need to have on hand:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>an existing HSBC HKD bank account or HKD credit card</li> 
 <li>your personal details and that of the proposed insured person's, such as HKID or birth certificate number, mobile number and email address</li> 
 <li>the proposed insured person's medical history records</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_main_richtext_8" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p>Yes, you can by submitting a written request before the deadline on your renewal notice.</p>
<p>No underwriting will be needed upon the policy renewal if you want to:</p>
<div class="commonMark-list">
<ul role="list">
<li>change from a Flexi Plan to a Standard Plan</li>
<li>increase your deductible amount</li>
<li>downgrade your plan level (eg from Diamond to Gold)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<p>However, underwriting is required and we may ask you a few questions before approving a change if you want to:</p>
<div class="commonMark-list">
<ul role="list">
<li>decrease your deductible amount (eg from HKD50,000 to HKD16,000)</li>
<li>upgrade your plan level (eg from Silver to Gold)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<p></p>
</div></div>

            <div class="footnote"><div id="pp_rel_footnote_1" class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-FOOTNOTES-RW-DEV" data-refs-visually-hidden="Footnote link" data-footnotes-json-path="/content/hsbc/hk/en_hk.dpws-footnotes.json" role="region">
    <div class="article-separator"> </div>
    
    <div class="row white">
        <div class="m-xsm-12 m-mdsm-10 m-md-8">
            
                <div class="footnote-title">
    
    
    














<h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL text-container text ">
    
    
        
        Notes
    
</h2>

</div>
            
            
            <ol class="A-TYPS6R-RW-DEV footnotes-list without-bottom-padding"><li><div id="fn-insurance-vhis-flexi-fullcoverage" tabindex="-1">Full coverage refers to the actual amount of eligible expenses and other expenses that are charged and payable per the terms and benefits of this policy. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-claims-paid-ratio-2022" tabindex="-1">Claims paid ratio is calculated as total claims amount paid divided by total claims amount incurred (after the consideration of any deductible and/or claims amount paid by first insurers for second claims, if applicable) in local currency, of the approved cases in 2022. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-vhis-flexi-familymembers" tabindex="-1">Family members include your spouse / partner, children, parents or parents-in-law, siblings or siblings-in-law, and grandparents or grandparents-in-law. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-vhis-flexi-cashlessarrangements" tabindex="-1">Pre-authorisation is required for cashless arrangements. The final decision for any pre-authorisation application or direct billing approval is subject to our discretion. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-vhis-flexi-medicalconcierge" tabindex="-1">Medical Concierge Service is not a part of the policy in respect of HSBC VHIS. A complimentary round-trip limousine service is available for insured persons of Diamond Plan to or from hospital for in-patient treatment in Hong Kong. For more details of the Medical Concierge Service, please refer to the detailed<a rel="noopener noreferrer" href="#how-to-apply"> terms and conditions</a>. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-taxdeductionvhis" tabindex="-1">Hong Kong taxpayer who is the policyholder of a policy issued under a certified plan of Voluntary Health Insurance Scheme (VHIS) may claim tax deductions for the premiums paid (excluding discount and levy) for yourself and your specified relatives up to HKD8,000 per insured person per assessment year. The amounts are for illustrative purposes only. The actual amounts of tax deductible and/or saving depend on the personal circumstances, and may be different from the amounts illustrated. For details, please visit the website of the Inland Revenue Department (<a rel="noopener noreferrer" href="http://www.ird.gov.hk/">ird.gov.hk</a>) or seek independent tax advice. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-vhis-flexi-geolimitations" tabindex="-1">Eligible expenses incurred in other areas worldwide shall be covered according to the VHIS Standard Plan terms and benefits. Greater China shall mean mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan. Asia shall mean Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Brunei, Greater China, India, Indonesia, Japan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Laos, Malaysia, Maldives, Mongolia, Myanmar, Nepal, Philippines, Singapore, South Korea, Tajikistan, Thailand, Timor-Leste, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan and Vietnam. Worldwide shall mean no geographical limitation, except for psychiatric treatment and cash benefit for lower ward classes which are applicable to Hong Kong only. Please refer to the additional benefit provisions endorsement for more details. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-lastbirthdaydefinition" tabindex="-1">The age refers to the age of the insured person on their last birthday. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-vhis-flexi-preexistingconditions" tabindex="-1">Pre-existing condition(s) shall mean, in respect of the insured person, any sickness, disease, injury, physical, mental or medical condition or physiological degradation, including congenital condition, that has existed prior to the policy issuance date or the policy effective date, whichever is earlier. Unknown pre-existing condition(s) refers to any pre-existing condition(s) that the policy holder and/or insured person was not aware and would not reasonably have been aware of at the time of application. Application is subject to HSBC Life. Please refer to the policy provisions for the full terms and conditions. </div></li></ol>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

    <p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">The HSBC VHIS Flexi Plan is a life insurance plan underwritten by HSBC Life (International) Limited ("HSBC Life") which is authorised and regulated by the Insurance Authority ("IA") to carry on long-term insurance business in the Hong Kong SAR. It is not a bank deposit or bank savings plan. Please refer to the product brochure for detailed features and the policy provisions for the detailed terms and conditions.</p>
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">HSBC Life is incorporated in Bermuda with limited liability, and is one of the HSBC Group's insurance underwriting subsidiaries. The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited ('HSBC') is registered in accordance with the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41 of the Laws of Hong Kong) as an agency of HSBC Life for the distribution of life insurance products in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. This product is a product of HSBC Life but not HSBC and it is intended only for sale in the Hong Kong SAR. Your benefit is subject to the credit risk of HSBC Life. Your premiums paid will form part of HSBC Life's assets. You do not have any rights or ownership over any of those assets. Your recourse is against HSBC Life only.</p>
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">In respect of an eligible dispute (as defined in the Terms of Reference for the Financial Dispute Resolution Centre in relation to the Financial Dispute Resolution Scheme) arising between HSBC and you out of the selling process or processing of the related transaction, HSBC is required to enter into a Financial Dispute Resolution Scheme process with you; however, any dispute over the contractual terms of the above insurance product should be resolved between HSBC Life and you directly.</p>
